title: Bug: Check Constrain Name Duplicate Name ( breaks MS SQL )
body:
Hi,

we have started using ML Flow 0.9.1 with MS SQL service and it looks like SCHEMA generate by mlflow has duplicate names for check constrains in `runs` and `experiments` tables.

Error log :

```
sqlalchemy.exc.ProgrammingError: (pyodbc.ProgrammingError) ('42S01', "[42S01] [Microsoft][ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server][SQL Server]There is already an object named 'lifecycle_stage' in the database. (2714) (SQLExecDirectW)")
[SQL: 
CREATE TABLE runs (
 run_uuid VARCHAR(32) NOT NULL, 
 name VARCHAR(250) NULL, 
 source_type VARCHAR(20) NULL, 
 source_name VARCHAR(500) NULL, 
 entry_point_name VARCHAR(50) NULL, 
 user_id VARCHAR(256) NULL, 
 status VARCHAR(20) NULL, 
 start_time BIGINT NULL, 
 end_time BIGINT NULL, 
 source_version VARCHAR(50) NULL, 
 lifecycle_stage VARCHAR(20) NULL, 
 artifact_uri VARCHAR(200) NULL, 
 experiment_id INTEGER NULL, 
 CONSTRAINT run_pk PRIMARY KEY (run_uuid), 
 CONSTRAINT source_type CHECK (source_type IN ('NOTEBOOK', 'JOB', 'LOCAL', 'UNKNOWN', 'PROJECT')), 
 CONSTRAINT status CHECK (status IN ('SCHEDULED', 'FAILED', 'FINISHED', 'RUNNING')), 
 CONSTRAINT lifecycle_stage CHECK (lifecycle_stage IN ('active', 'deleted')), 
 FOREIGN KEY(experiment_id) REFERENCES experiments (experiment_id)
)
]
```


MS SQL doesn't support constrains name duplicates across the SCHEMA/DB.

it can be mitigated by renaming constrains in lines 61 and 139 to include a table name prefix.

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/fcc87c4965e2141fff996826b5e2f9780a996059/mlflow/store/dbmodels/initial_models.py#L61

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/fcc87c4965e2141fff996826b5e2f9780a996059/mlflow/store/dbmodels/initial_models.py#L139
